newsitem.title: FRANCE: Cerus, Valeo up on Benedetti exit.
newsitem.headline: Cerus, Valeo up on Benedetti exit.

text.p: French holding company Cerus and car parts maker Valeo were both up sharply on Wednesday on speculative buying following the resignation of Carlo de Benedetti as chairman of Olivetti, traders said.
Cerus was up 6.52 percent or 7.00 francs at 98.35 on 379,225 shares traded while Valeo was more than three percent higher, up 6.70 francs at 262.60 francs on 156,071 shares exchanged.
Traders said De Benedetti's resignation in a board battle late Tuesday had rekindled speculation that his holding company, Cerus, might spin off its 28 percent stake in Valeo.
Traders suggested De Benedetti might now adopt a new strategy toward his Valeo stake.

Cerus vice-chairman Michel Cicurel last July the company would consider "an interesting offer if it was made, otherwise we have no reason to dispose of this magnificent stake," adding Cerus expected Valeo to be at 400 francs per share in 1998.

Meanwhile, brokerage Massonaud boosted its rating to plus from neutral on Cerus, citing De Benedetti's departure as well as what it said was the share's undervaluation against a re-evaluated net asset worth of 160 francs.
